name: Commander: Conquest of the Americas
description: Combining elements from both trading and strategy games, Commander: Conquest of the Americas will appeal to a wide range of players. Players take charge of one of the many European powers aiming to conquer the New World.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 / Vista / XP Processor: 2.0 GHz Core Duo or equivalent Memory: 2 GB RAM Hard Disk Space: 4 GB Video Card: 256 MB of dedicated memory with support for pixel shader 3.0. NVIDIA 7800 or equivalent Sound Card: DirectX9 compatible Controller Support: 3-button mouse, keyboard and speakers

reviews.review_text: This game as it is is an interesting mix of tactics and naval warfare in the Carribean area.  It desperately needs some attention from its developers due to some annoying bugs which slipped in, but it is still playable.  If you like games like Sid Meier's Pirates, Port Royale, and the like, this will be right up your alley.
If you really like a challenge in strategy games like trade and economy then this game is for you
not the best game good idea just controlls arent great best to buy if fairly cheap or on sale
A beautiful game, but depressingly boring. Guess that isn't really a recommendation.

Got the game on sale on steam. A good theme purchase, with a unique challenge. I don't know If I want to continue playing it or just send it to the junk pile. (Suggest seeing hours played after review date) - It is best to get the game when on sale.
